title: Bug 3622 - New Package Wizard has confusing message
description: New Package Wizard displays a confusing message when the package name field is empty.
OB: When invoking the New Java Package feature, the following message appears at the top: 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists'. This message is displayed even when the package name field is empty.
EB: The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not be displayed when the package name field is empty.
SR:
To reproduce the issue:
1. Open the New Java Package wizard.
2. Leave the package name field empty.
3. Click on the 'Finish' button.
Expected result: The message 'A folder corresponding to the package name already exists' should not be displayed.
